titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 31
CWG11563

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
SPEICAL ORDERS, No. 31.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE
Washington, January 20th, 1865

(Extract.)
19. Leave of absence for thirty days is hereby granted the following officers, paroled Prisoners of War, at the expiration of which they will report in person to the Commanding Officer of Camp Chase, Columbus, Ohio: --
Major William N. Owens, 1st Kentucky Cavalry.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICAL:
E. D. Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjt Genls. Office
Washington Jany 20/65
Townsend E. D. A. A. G.
Order
granting 30 days leave of absence to Maj W. N. Owens 1' Cavy.
Recd A. G. O. Jany 26. 1865
